result.execSummary:
The defendant John M Hering was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery of a Financial Institution, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.87.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay DNA surcharge, plus costs and disbursements.  To be taken by DOC from prison funds not to exceed 25%.  Balance to be paid while on Extended supervision.  Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain employment. Be given job and vocational training.
Undergo a mental health evaluation. Follow any treatment recommended.

No contact with Ms. Felicia M.
No contact with Pyramax Bank, 8001 W. National Avenue, City of West Allis, WI.
No controlled substances other than those legally prescribed for defendant by a duly licensed physician for defendant's mental or physical needs. Take only as prescribed and for only as long as deemed reasonable and necessary.
No alcohol.
AODA assessment and treatment.  Urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample if not previously taken.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms or body armor; further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John M Hering

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (20 pages) commencing APRIL 16, 2015, received and filed.  jm

Received and filed:
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant John M Hering in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant John M Hering in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing proceeds.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms or body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 20.  File retained in court.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court, defendant John M Hering not in court, in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a plea date.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court, defendant John M Hering not in court, in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested another scheduling date to go over offer with client.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court, defendant John M Hering not in court, in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for DeAnn L. Heard for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel need an offer.  Case is adjourned for scheduling before Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing 01/27/2015 received and filed. (18 Pages)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Atty. Darryl Smith, 819 North 6th Street, Milwaukee, WI.

Defendant John M Hering in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Jeritt Mees-West Allis Police Department Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is   adjourned to Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with PYRAMAX BANK AND FELICIA M.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant John M Hering in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant John M Hering in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MORONEY, Branch 20.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
